# Objetivo 
In RSA d is a lot bigger than e, why don't we use d to encrypt instead of e? Connect with `nc jupiter.challenges.picoctf.org 57464`.
# Solución 
```
┌──(jordan㉿kali)-[~/Pico/Cry/Cry2]
└─$ nc jupiter.challenges.picoctf.org 57464  
c: 
n: 
e: 


┌──(jordan㉿kali)-[~/Pico/Cry/Cry2]
└─$ python3 
Python 3.11.8 (main, Feb  7 2024, 21:52:08) [GCC 13.2.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> 
>>> n = 
>>> 
>>> e=65537
>>> e
65537
>>> 
>>> m= pow(c,d,n)
>>> m

>>> from Crypto.Util.number import long_to_bytes 
>>> long_to_bytes(m)
b'd\x17\x00k\xd8\xae\x9a\xe1\xe9\x8b\xce\xde\n\xf21\xcf\xc2`\xf2\x9bd:qy\x8f\xa5H$\xf2C\x00&\x1at3\x91A\xef\xe8\xfa\xf9\xef\xe1\x01\x0c\xc5\x00sUU\x8bt]\xba\x05\xd7\xc8t\xbcW\xee{\x9b\x95\xbcI\xd0\xd96+\xbb\x8f\x83\xb0V\xe8ad\x85Y\x95\xc8\xb8\x00\x9c\x85\x10r\xfd\x0c\x9cb\xa1\x88\xb1\x93\xd8Ma\xe3\xfe\xefL\xd1m\x92k\xa6\xde4R\xfagCQyp\xc8n\xf2\xad\x9b\xe2\x1f&*Fb'
>>> m= pow(c,e,n)
>>> m
180638594769037903267909311328535969949661653320322151351464061
>>> long_to_bytes(m)
b'picoCTF{bad_1d3a5_2152720}'
>>> 

picoCTF{bad_1d3a5_2152720}

```
